title: 2 Euro (Union of the Dodecanese with Greece)

composition.text: Bimetallic: nickel brass clad nickel centre in copper-nickel ring

obverse.description: A rose, the canting badge of Rhodes, inspired from a coin minted by the ancient city of Rhodes, one of the most characteristic coins of the Dodecanese, with stylised waves fanning out from the centre. Inscribed along the inner edge is the wording ‘1948-2018 THE UNION OF THE DODECANESE WITH GREECE’ and the country name. Also visible at left is a palmette (the mintmark of the Greek mint) and, at right, the monogram of the artist (George Stamatopoulos). The coin’s outer ring depicts the 12 stars of the European flag.
obverse.lettering:
1948-2018 Η ΕΝΩΣΗ ΤΩΝ ΔΩΔΕΚΑΝΗΣΩΝ ΜΕ ΤΗΝ ΕΛΛΑΔΑ
ΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΗ ΔΗΜΟΚΡΑΤΙΑ
obverse.lettering_translation:
1948-2018 The Union of Dodecanese WITH Greece
Hellenic Republic

reverse.description: A map, next to the face value, shows the European continent without borders.

commemorated_topic: 70 Years Since the Union of the Dodecanese with Greece
comments:
After the end of World War II, under the peace treaty signed with Italy, the Italian-occupied Dodecanese islands were ceded to Greece. The official unification ceremony took place on 7 March 1948.
The coin was issued in bankrolls and in Proof quality along with the Official Hellenic Proof Euro Coin Set in a wooden box with the certificate of authenticity.

mints.name: The National Mint of the Bank of Greece
